memberdef.argsstring: (Dimension &dimension, T x, T y, T z, const float pitch=0.0, const float yaw=0.0)
memberdef.name: Location

briefdescription.para: Sets the dimension that this position resides in.

parameterdescription.para: New dimension that this position resides in

briefdescription.para: Gets the dimension that this location resides in.
Gets the block at the represented location.
Sets the x-coordinate of this location.
Gets the x-coordinate of this location.
Gets the floored value of the X component, indicating the block that this location is contained with.
Sets the y-coordinate of this location.
Gets the y-coordinate of this location.
Gets the floored value of the Y component, indicating the block that this location is contained with.
Sets the z-coordinate of this location.
Gets the z-coordinate of this location.
Gets the floored value of the Z component, indicating the block that this location is contained with.
Gets the pitch of this location, measured in degrees.
Sets the pitch of this location, measured in degrees.

listitem.para: A pitch of 0 represents level forward facing.
A pitch of 90 represents downward facing, or negative y direction.
A pitch of -90 represents upward facing, or positive y direction.

detaileddescription.para: Increasing pitch values the equivalent of looking down.

briefdescription.para: Gets the yaw of this location, measured in degrees.
Sets the yaw of this location, measured in degrees.

listitem.para: A yaw of 0 or 360 represents the positive z direction.
A yaw of 180 represents the negative z direction.
A yaw of 90 represents the negative x direction.
A yaw of 270 represents the positive x direction.

detaileddescription.para: Increasing yaw values are the equivalent of turning to your right-facing, increasing the scale of the next respective axis, and decreasing the scale of the previous axis.

briefdescription.para: Gets a unit-vector pointing in the direction that this Location is facing.

simplesect.para: a vector pointing the direction of this location's pitch and yaw

briefdescription.para: Sets the yaw and pitch to point in the direction of the vector.
Gets the magnitude of the location, defined as sqrt(x^2+y^2+z^2).
Gets the magnitude of the location squared.
Get the distance between this location and another.
Get the squared distance between this location and another.
Zero this vector's components. Not world-aware.
Normalizes the given yaw angle to a value between +/-180 degrees.
Normalizes the given pitch angle to a value between +/-90 degrees.
Represents a 3-dimensional location in a dimension within a level.
